briefTitle: Study Evaluating the Efficacy and Safety of Obeticholic Acid in Subjects With Compensated Cirrhosis Due to Nonalcoholic Steatohepatitis
officialTitle: A Phase 3, Double-Blind, Randomized, Placebo-Controlled, Multicenter Study to Evaluate the Efficacy and Safety of Obeticholic Acid in Subjects With Compensated Cirrhosis Due to Nonalcoholic Steatohepatitis
summary: The primary objective of this study is to evaluate whether obeticholic acid (OCA; INT-747) can lead to histological improvement in fibrosis with no worsening of NASH in adults with compensated cirrhosis due to NASH.

primaryOutcome.measure: DB Phase: Number of Participants Who Were Responders and Showed Improvement in Fibrosis by at Least 1 Stage Without Worsening of Nonalcoholic Steatohepatitis (NASH)

effectByArm.arm: DB: OCA 10 mg Titrated to OCA 25 mg
